subject: World of Ice and Fire App
event:
So the official George and his publisher approved World of Ice and Fire app is available.  I can attest to the fact that he personally worked on this project, because I sat and took notes as we went over hundreds of questions on random Ice and Fire arcana.  No, it didn't delay Winds of Winter.  I made him do it while he ate lunch.  Yes, he complains when I make him work during lunch.

The most iPhone literate person in our office had this to say after playing with the app for a while:

"Have you ever forgotten who killed who, or who's who's parents while having a conversation at a coffee shop or between novels on the bus?  Well now that The new official WORLD OF ICE AND FIRE app is available you can fact check any and all things Ice and fire anywhere you find yourself.  The app is on sale for the iPad, iPhone, and Nook, a limited  free version of the app is up and ready for fans to download with additional info pack available as well.  It features profiles of more than 540 characters, 380 places, and major houses, along with interactive world maps.  This exclusive guide to all things Ice and Fire is easy to navigate featuring beautiful art, and easy touch access to any query you may have on your journey through Westerous.   You can read new text specially written for the app by Elio M. Garcia and Jr. and Linda Antonsson all about your favorite characters and their histories.  So go and download yours today and get access to the World of Ice and Fire at your fingertips."

Sounds like a ringing endorsement to me.  Ordering links are included below:

Six InfoPacks to Choose From – Buy Once and Get Free Updates

    A Game of Thrones - $1.99
    A Clash of Kings - $.99
    A Storm of Swords - $.99
    A Feast For Crows - $.99
    A Dance With Dragons - $.99
    Five Novel InfoPack – Get all five InfoPacks for only $4.99

https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/george-r.-r.-martins-world/id570015223?mt=8
 
http://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/george-r-r-martins-a-world-of-ice-and-fire-a-game-of-thrones-guide-random-house-digital-inc/1113865902?ean=2940043934550

comments.article:
Any plans for a version for those of us on the more robotically inclined mobile platform, or is this strictly for the orchard frolicking folk?

(Is it coming for Android is what I'm saying. ;))
It's out for the Nook, and Nooks run Android.

This is very awesome and cool.

Thanks for all the hard work you do for Mr. Martin.
Awesome! I think I'll pick it up for my Nook. But, then again I don't want to stop reading on my Nook to look up info so it'll probably be better to get it on my iPhone.
Will there be an Android version available?
comments.subject: Android Version?

comments.subject: Android

comments.article: Could you release an android version, please? Pleasssse..
It's now available only in US store. Any plans to release an internationally available version ?

FYI, HUGE spoiler in the Castamere listing. I have only downloaded the free version so far and admittedly did not set any of the spoiler blocking settings, but I would expect the default content to be as spoiler free as possible. I would certainly expect it not to spoil this plot point, it's a bad one to sneak through.

Beautiful art and GUI though.

I think this app deserves to be cross-platforms (Android, but also Windows Phone) and cross-countries too (you have a lot of fans all around the world who'd wish to access this, even in its English form ;)).

Otherwise, it's a great idea!
For the first time, I wish I had an iPhone or something else that has "apps."  :x
Wow.  Fans are demanding, aren't they?  :)
Customers.
I second the call for an Android version!
I'll 6th that, I'd buy it for Android.
I must have missed the post where you introduced yourself but I like the briskly irreverent tone to your updates....Good to know work is continuing on TWOW ;)
comments.subject: I like

comments.article: How do the apps differ from simply using A Wiki of Ice and Fire via your phone's internet function?

It's prettier. Lots of nice art. But it's not so in-depth as the Citadel or the Wiki of Ice and Fire, no. It's a companion guide for reading the books, and can be very convenient, especially as it works offline.

That said, it's very much aimed to a particular segment of the readership. It's not necessarily meant for those who prefer using Westeros.org to look things up, or who are really hardcore fans. There's some new information in there, but mostly it's just a concise way of presenting character and location information.

I don't figure this will come out for Symbian? XD
But Android at least would be very very nice.
I really need this - but my phone is Android!

I just downloaded the app yesterday. My personal Mac IT guy (AKA my Husband) sent me the app as soon as he saw it and NOW I just bought all 4 books for the special discounted price of $5 for all 5 books. YAY!!! This will be fun to peruse!
I love my Aqoiaf!! XOXO
comments.subject: LOVE IT!!

comments.article:
The Nooks run Android, don't they? So why release an Android app on a closed store for a device that appears to be unavailable outside of America?

Or have B&N paid for an exclusive period?

Would you let us know when those outside of B&N's walled garden and the US will be allowed to buy it, please?
comments.subject: Why Nook?
